comments:
I use Eclipse 3.0M4 and wrote different classes in my workspace. I also use 
often a package i wrote, the packagename is "ch.rolandschaer.myUtil". I 
attached the JAR file to the JRE standarf library, this way it's available in 
each new project. 
When i upgraded to the new release M5 i always get a NoClassDefFound Error in 
each project i import this package. The weird thing is that the error seems to 
come from the compiler not from Eclipse itself.
Do you have a stack trace or log file with more details?

Created an attachment (id=7214)
Sample project with package

The error i get when i run this application is:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: ch/rolandschaer/myUtil/Text
	at Main.main(Main.java:30)
Exception in thread "main"

The JRE system library path is used at compile time only.  If you add JARs to
that set, you will be able to compile against the extra JAR, but not run it.  If
you want extra JARs to be globally available at run-time, then you have to use
one of the mechanisms that the VM provides for doing this.  To add JARs to the
runtime classpath, you need to add it to the boot classpath.  For most VMs this
is done with the "-Xbootclasspath" command line argument.  Read your VM
documentation for more details.

Ok. But why this worked in the Eclipse M4 release? Was this a lack which 
you've fixed now?
